explanations.a: Correct. The mean is calculated by summing all values (5.669) and dividing by the number of values (10), which gives 0.5669.

questions.question:

questions.question: 5. Suppose that within a very large corporation salaries are positively skewed with a mean of 40,000 dollars and a standard deviation of 20,000 dollars. Which statement is true for a sample of workers?

answers.a: At least 68.3 percent of workers have a salary between 20,000 dollars and 60,000 dollars
answers.b: At least 75.0 percent of workers have a salary between 20,000 dollars and 60,000 dollars
answers.c: At least 88.9 percent of workers have a salary below 100,000 dollars
answers.d: At least 95.4 percent of workers have a salary below 100,000 dollars

explanations.a: This would be true for a normal distribution, but the data is positively skewed, so we cannot make this assumption.
explanations.b: This would be true for a normal distribution, but the data is positively skewed, so we cannot make this assumption.
explanations.c: Without knowing the exact shape of the skewed distribution, we cannot make this claim.
explanations.d: Without knowing the exact shape of the skewed distribution, we cannot make this claim.
explanations.e: Correct. Since the distribution is positively skewed, we cannot make assumptions about the percentage of workers in any salary range without more information about the distribution.
